questions.question: 1. In the standard (x, y)coordinate plane below, the coordinates of the 8 points A through H form a pattern in which the x-coordinate of B is 1 less than the x-coordinate of A, and the y-coordinate of B is 1 more than the y-coordinate of A; the x-coordinate of C is 1 less than the x-coordinate of B, and the y-coordinate of C is 1 more than the y-coordinate of B; and so on What are the coordinates of H?
2. There are 16 buttons in a bag: 9 are red, 4 are blue, and 3 are white. What is the probability that a button chosen are random from the bag is NOT white?

3. A certain frosting recipe calls for 3 tablespoons of cocoa and 2 tablespoons of water. Curt put 12 tablespoons of cocoa in his bowl. How many tablespoons of water should he add to maintain the ratio of cocoa to water in this frosting recipe?
4. For matrix , its transpose, , is . What is ?
5. The area of a square cement foundation of a shelter in a city park is 64 square yards. What is the length, in yards, of the cement foundation?
6. What id the largest value of x for which there exists a real value of y such that x2 + y2 = 441?
7. 3x4 · 5x6 is equivalent to :
8. In the figure below, D is on , the measure of ∠DBE equals 35°, and the measure of ∠DEB equals 87°. What is the measure of ∠CDB?
9. In trapezoid PQST shown below, the midpoint of  is U and the midpoint of  is R. The line segments , , and  are parallel. The given dimension are in decimeters. How many decimeters long is ?

11. Lydia and Roberta are painting a room in the city recreation center. They started with 6 gallons of paint. On the first day, Lydia used  gallon of paint and Roberta used  gallons of paint. How many gallons of paint were left after the first day?
13. The mass of Particle P is 0.000 000 000 084 7 grams. In scientific notation, what is the mass, in grams, of Particle P?
14. One number is 6 less than another. When the 2 numbers are added, their sum is 20. What is the smaller number?

15. Shantiel left her home at 11: 00 a.m. on Tuesday and traveled 602 miles. When she arrived at her destination it was 1: 00 a m. the next day. If her home and her destination are in the same time zone. which of the following is closest to her average speed, in miles per hour, for this trip?

16. In the school cafeteria, students choose their lunch from 2 sandwiches, 4 soups, 2 salads, and 5 drinks. How many different lunches are possible for a student who chooses exactly 1 sandwich, 1 soup, 1 salad, and 1 drink?

17. The regular price of a skirt is $30.00. The skirt is on sale for 10% off the regular price. An unadvertised discount, for today only, has reduced the sale price of the skirt by 10% of the sale price. What is the price of the skirt today?(Note: Ignore sales tax.)
18.  What is the slope of the line through (4, 7)and (-2, 8) in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane?
19. A function f(x) s=is defined as f(x) = -2x2. What is f(-5)?

20.  When a ball is dropped from a height of h feet, the average speed of the ball from the time it is dropped until it hits the ground is  feet per second. When the ball is dropped from a height of 400 feet, what is its average speed, in feet per second, from drop to hitting the ground?

21. A BMX biker is using a ramp to perform jumps. The ramp is 50 feet long and 20 feet high, as shown in the figure below. The measure of the angle from the ground to the ramp is θ. Which of the following equations must be true about θ?
22. What is the solution set of x2 - 13x + 36 = 0?

24. The senior class is having a soup-and-sandwich supper to raise money for a graduation party. The menu is shown below.If a supper consists of 1 soup and l sandwich, about what percent of the supper choices cost $2.50 ?

25. To receive a grade of C in Mrs. Inoue's Algebra class, a student's class score, s, must differ from 75 points by no more than 8 points. Which of the following number line graphs represents the range of all class scores for which a student would receive a C ?

26. An empty rectangular swimming pool is 12 ft wide and 30 ft long and has a uniform depth of 9 ft.Water will be pumped into the pool at the rate of 3 cubic feet per second. About how many minutes will it take to completely fill the pool?

27. A-1 Cab Company's fare is a base fee of $3.00 per ride plus a fee of $0.15 per mile or part thereof. Jill's Taxi Company's fare has no base fee, only a fee of $0.25 per mile or part thereof. For which of the following numbers of miles is the fare equal for both companies?

28. The company logo for Oroszco Pemberton Jiron Company(OPJ Co), shown below, is displayed on the doors of the company's headquarters. The letters "OPJ" form a rectangle, and the letters "Co” form a square. The square has a perimeter of 60 inches. The rectangle has a width that is 6 inches shorter than a side of the square and a length that is 5 inches longer than aside of the same square. What is the area, in square inches, of the "OPJ" rectangle?
29. The inequality 7(x + 4) > 8(x - 6) is equivalent to which of the following inequalities?
30. A positive integer is multiplied by 3, and that result is multiplied by 4. Which of the following numbers could be the result after the second multiplication?
31. The measure of any angle inscribed in a circle is  the measure of the intercepted arc. Points A, B, and C are on the circle shown below. What is the measure of ∠ABC?
32. For what value of a would the system of equations below have infinitely many solutions?                            2x -   y = 6                             4x - 2y = 2a
33. The diameter of a circle is 50 feet, as shown in the figure below. What is the circumference of the circle, in feet?

34. A particular circle in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane has an equation of (x - 6)² + y² = 47. What are the radius of the circle, in coordinate units, and the coordinates of the center of the circle?
35. Whenever x ≠ -1,   = ?

36. Jesse had m marbles.He received 30 more marbles for doing his chores at home. After that, he gave 25 marbles to his younger sister. Jesse now decides to store his marbles in 5 small jars, so he divides his marbles so he has the same number of marbles in each jar. Which of the following expressions gives the number of marbles in each jar?

37. Use the following information to answer questions 37-40.ln the figure below, T is the midpoint of NR and of PS, MT and NP are perpendicular to PS, and NQ is parallel to MT and RS.37.  The measures of which of the following pairs of angles necessarily sum to 90°?

38. Use the following information to answer questions 37-40.ln the figure below, T is the midpoint of NR and of PS, MT and NP are perpendicular to PS, and NQ is parallel to MT and RS.38. The measure of ∠PTR is 2 times the measure of ∠NTP. What is the measure of ∠PTR ?

39. Use the following information to answer questions 37-40.ln the figure below, T is the midpoint of NR and of PS, MT and NP are perpendicular to PS, and NQ is parallel to MT and RS.39. Which of the following is an expression for  in terms of ∠RTS ?

40. Use the following information to answer questions 37-40.ln the figure below, T is the midpoint of NR and of PS, MT and NP are perpendicular to PS, and NQ is parallel to MT and RS.40. Which of the following statements is NOT necessarily true?
41. The coordinates of the endpoints of AB, in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane, are (-3,-9) and (7,9). What is the x-coordinate of the midpoint of AB ?
42. In △ABC, the length of AC is 10 mm, ∠B is a right angle, and ∠A measures 30°. What is the length, in millimeters, of BC ?

43. Use the following information to answer questions 43 and 44.Miguel conducted a telephone poll of a random sample of 150 of the 63,000 high school seniors in his state. Each responded to:1.Do you have a grade average of B or above?2.Have you ever been stopped for speeding?He organized his data into the table below.43. Which of the following is closest to the percent of seniors in the sample who answered ”Yes" to having a grade average of B or above and “No" to being stopped for speeding?

44. Use the following information to answer questions 43 and 44.Miguel conducted a telephone poll of a random sample of 150 of the 63,000 high school seniors in his state. Each responded to:1.Do you have a grade average of B or above?2.Have you ever been stopped for speeding?He organized his data into the table below.44. Miguel drew a graph with 2 bars representing the responses about grade average. On top of each bar, he wrote how many seniors it represented. He shaded the lower portion of each bar to represent "Yes" to being stopped for speeding.On top of each shaded portion, he wrote how many seniors it represented. He left the rest of each bar unshaded to represent "No” to being stopped for speeding. Which of the following is Miguel's bar graph?

45. A carpenter has 24 triangular sheets of wood flooring, each a right triangle with dimensions in feet, as shown below. What is the maximum length, in feet, of a rectangular floor 12 feet wide that can be completely covered with these 24 sheets of flooring?
46. If 5 - (5 + y) = 5 - (5 - x) and y ≠ 0. what is the value of ?
47. The ratio of the side lengths of 2 squares is 2 : 3. What is the ratio of the length of the diagonal of the smaller square to the length of the diagonal of the larger square?
48. Which of the following inequalities gives , ,  in increasing order?(Note: In this notation, the bar over a digit or block of digits signifies that the digit or block of digits repeats endlessly.)
49. For △DGF shown below, the only known measures are length f and the angle measures for∠D, ∠G, and ∠F. Which of the following gives length d?(Note: The law of sines gives the equation .)

50. A line segment has endpoints (a, b) and (c, d) in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane, where a, b, c, and d are distinctive positive integers. The segment is reflected across the x-axis. After this reflection, what are the coordinates of the endpoints of the image?
51. What is the distance, in coordinate units, between the points (1,3) and (-1,-3) in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane?
52. Given the complex number a + bi, where a and b are real numbers and i² = -1, the absolute value of a + bi is given by .Which of the following has the greatest absolute value?
53. Suppose the operation ⊕ is defined by a ⊕ b = . What is the value of (98 ⊕ 77) ⊕ (21 ⊕ 49)?
54. What is the area, in square coordinate units, of the region bounded by the lines 3x - 8y = 0, x = 8, and y = 0 in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane?

55. The Ferris wheel shown below rotates counterclockwise around the center and has a radius of 40 feet. Riders get on at the wheel's lowest point, S, 12 feet above the ground. An angle is measured counterclockwise from S to a random point on the wheel. In terms of α, which of the following expressions gives the height, in feet, of that point above the ground?
56. The distance, in feet, a ball is from the ground t seconds after being thrown upward is modeled by f(t) = -16t² + 24t + 32. The number 32 in this equation represents which of the following?

choices.A: The number of seconds the ball will take to reach the ground
choices.B: The velocity of the ball when it is thrown
choices.C: The velocity of the ball when it hits the ground
choices.D: The distance the ball is from the ground when it is at its highest point.
choices.E: The distance the ball is from the ground when it is thrown

questions.question: 57. If f(x) = 3x - 5, then f(f(x)) = ?

58. A vacation resort consists of several housing groups, each composed of at least 3 cabins arranged around a circle as shown below. Within a group, each pair of cabins is connected by a straight concrete path. A new 10-cabin group is being planned for the resort. How many paths would have to be built for this group?

59. Every year, Marmot Creek Forest Preserve issues to individuals these types of activity permits: hiking, canoeing, and biking. Each individual can be issued 1 type, 2 types, or all 3 types of these permits. All permits expire on the last day of the year. The preserve issues their limit of 1,000 hiking permits, 700 canoeing permits, and 200 biking permits every year. For a year, what is the minimum number of individuals that can be issued a hiking permit only?

60. Cassandra has a collection of animal figurines of various solid colors. She makes the following true statement about the collection: "If a figurine is blue, then the figurine is a cat." Which of the following statements about the collection is logically equivalent to Cassandra's statement?

choices.A: “A figurine is a cat if and only if it is blue."
choices.B: "If a figurine is a cat, then the figurine is blue."
choices.C: “If a figurine is a cat, then the figurine is NOT blue."
choices.D: “If a figurine is NOT blue, then the figurine is NOT a cat."
choices.E: “If a figurine is NOT a cat, then the figurine is NOT blue."
